item.title: Lec2: CAVE System
item.description:
CAVE System

CAVE (“Cave Automatic Virtual Environment”) is a new irtual reality interface. It consists of a room whose walls, ceiling and floor surround a viewer with projected images.

Difference between CAVE System and Head-Mounted Displays

CAVE allows user play without carrying any hardware.

advantages:

  1. allows multiple users to experience the same VR enrionment simultaneously, as it doesn’t require individual headsets.
  2. enhances the suspenson of disbelief by immersing users in a roomscale environment
  3. avoids common issues of HMD, such as discomfort or limited field of view.

disadvantages:

  1. requires a large space
  2. high costs for construction and equipement such as projectors and tracking systems
  3. not very portable

The Reality-Virtuality Continuum

I believe the CAVE system can be put around augmented reality, because CAVE is not purely virtual. The virtual world in CAVE system is augmented with physical objects (wall and projectors).

When more people are experiencing the CAVE at the same time, it will be closer to augmented reality than to virtual environment, because they are seen in a real view.

item.title: Lec1: VR Fails
item.description:
VR Fails

Scenario 1ï¼š run and crash on other people or objects

People who using VR headset cannot see the real environment around them and misjudge the space. When they are involved in dynamic situation or jump scare, they would be excited and forget the limited space in real world, running or jumping and crashing into others.

Solution 1:

We can tackle such kind of VR Fails by control the position of moving people. For example, Disney introduced VR Floor on which walking people won’t move away.

We have to admit that currently VR Floor cannot manage short sharp movement. It’s not a final solution for every VR fails.

Scenario 2: Hit the people or dog who come in your play area

Even if you prepare a safe and empty room and you don’t move at all, it’s still possible for you to hurt others because they may be unconscious of your situation.

For example here, the girl kicked the dog because the dog come into her play area.

Solution 2

One solution is to detect the approaching people or animal and remind the VR headset user. It is easy and usually works.

item.title: Lab4: Roll-A-Ball in VR
item.description:
adapt roll-a-ball into VR

Set up environment

  • create a new 3d project
  • File -> Build Profiles -> Android -> Switch Platform. Because Oculus we use is running on Android.
  • Import Oculus Integration to Unity, Though Oculus Integration is shown deprecated in Assetstore in 2024. To be consistent with the tutorials I follow, I didn’t use All in One SDK, which is the updated one. There is another reason: I don’t have OVR prefabs downloaded in Assets Folder with All in One SDK.
  • You may need to import Oculus XR Plugin for some version.
  • Project Setting -> XR Plug-In Management, check the Oculus for both the Android and PC.

Reuse Roll a ball

Following the tutorial provided in the course, I export the Roll-A-Ball game as a .unitypackage file by Assets -> Export Pacakge. There is something to tweak:

Then prepare the scene for the game.

  • Create a huge plane as the floor
  • a cube as a table
  • put them as children of an Empty Object named Environment
  • remove Main Camera and use the Assets -> Oculus -> VR -> Prefabs -> OVRCameraRig instead. Set the tracking to Floor Level and the Color Gamut to Quest.
    • tips: you may find “convert Main Camera” or something like that to conver Main Camera to OVRCameraRig if you use All-in-one SDK. I didn’t test it but I believe it should work.
  • add OVRControllerPrefab for both HandAnchors. LeftControllerAnchor for L Touch, RightControllerAnchor for R Touch.

Now we can import the .unitypackage file and put it on the table. some tips:

  1. put them as children of an empty object named roll-a-ball
  2. initialize empty object “roll-a-ball” position before binding old objects to it.
  3. rebake navMesh after resizing the ground if you want to keep the navMesh. for me, I only pick Player, Ground, Walls, Pickups.
  4. You can keep the previous UI! just need to select World Space in Canvas -> Render Mode. Remember to set reference back to our PlayerController script of roll-a-ball.

Add Colliders and Layers

  • create two layers “selection” for roll-a-ball gameobject and its all children.
  • add a box collider to the Ground and fit the size.
  • set Left/RightHandAnchor to selection layer too.
  • add a SphereCollider and adjust the radius to the same size of the controller prefab. Remember to check IsTigger
  • Edit -> Project Settings -> Physics, uncheck roll-a-ball layer with selection layer.
  • add rigid body on anchors and roll-a-ball if you don’t do that before. check kinematic for anchors and useGravity for Roll-a-ball.

using System.Collections;
using System.Collections.Generic;
using UnityEngine;

public class MySelct : MonoBehaviour
{
    public OVRInput.Controller controller;
    private float triggerValue;
    [SerializeField] private bool isInCollider;
    [SerializeField] private bool isSelected;
    private GameObject selectedObj;

    // Update is called once per frame
    void Update()
    {
        // Here we called the IndexTrigger value from controller,
        // so the Primary will map to right hand when the inspectoris RTouch in Unity.
        triggerValue = OVRInput.Get(OVRInput.Axis1D.PrimaryIndexTrigger, controller);

        if(isInCollider)
        {
            // not selected and pull the trigger
            if (!isSelected && triggerValue > 0.95f)
            {
                isSelected = true;
                selectedObj.transform.parent = this.transform;
                Rigidbody rb = selectedObj.GetComponent<Rigidbody>();
                rb.isKinematic = true;
                rb.useGravity = false;
                rb.velocity = Vector3.zero;
                rb.angularVelocity = Vector3.zero;
            }
            else if (isSelected && triggerValue <0.95f)
            {
                isSelected = false;
                selectedObj.transform.parent = null;
                Rigidbody rb = selectedObj.GetComponent<Rigidbody>();
                rb.isKinematic = false;
                rb.useGravity = true;
                rb.velocity = OVRInput.GetLocalControllerVelocity(controller);
                rb.angularVelocity = OVRInput.GetLocalControllerAngularVelocity(controller);
            }
        }
    }

    void OnTriggerEnter(Collider other)
    {
        if(other.gameObject.name == "roll-a-ball")
        {
            isInCollider = true;
            selectedObj = other.gameObject;
        }
    }

    void OnTriggerExit(Collider other)
    {
        if (other.gameObject.name == "roll-a-ball")
        {
            isInCollider = false;
            selectedObj = null;
        }
    }
}

then you can install the APK to the Oculus Quest headset. Remember to turn on developper mode.

item.title: Lab3: Roll a ball & 3 Selections
item.description:
Roll a Ball

steps

  1. ball and background
  2. player control. I also added a IPP Logo as the material of the ball.

Camera

I put IPP logo to the ground and it looks better.

It feels bad to put every new script from /Assets to /Assets/Scripts as mentioned in the tutorial. Though there is no way to set default path for new script, I find a solution: create new script in Assets/Scripts in project window and attach it to the object. However, the script is hidden in the 3rd level of right click menu, which is tedious.

Walls

Walls work well and it’s interesting that the wall is able to go beyond the wall with high speed.

PickUp

I put pickups on the path shown in the logo.

Score

I encountered a problem that I cannot find the left-top scores. I finally found out that it is because of the improper “Scale” of the Game view.

Obstacle

A serious problem: distortion of cube when rotating the cube, which leads to the separation between the cube and the box collider. solution: add an empty parent for the cube

I utilize hugo to build the blog and Github Pages to host.

I choose FixIt theme which is not bad. I am considering to switch to another theme to have preview photo in menu. Anyway, it doesn’t matter.

Setup hugo and theme

  2. create website:

I encountered a problem that some old theme is not compiled with the latest hugo. That’s one reason I choose FixIt.

publish website

  1. create repo in github and name it username.github.io. Notice: keep it as a private repo. you can solve the authentication problem by at least three methods:
    1. repo-level token
    2. user-level token
    3. ssh authentication
